meanings.definition: A lay officer in a parish church, responsible for the care of the church building and its contents.
meanings.sent1: The churchwarden unlocked the doors of the church every morning.
meanings.sent2: The churchwarden organized the repair of the church roof.
meanings.sent3: The churchwarden joked that the church mice were his tiny helpers.
meanings.sent4: She was the churchwarden of kindness, always looking out for those in need.
meanings.sent5: The churchwarden's dedication to the church was unwavering.

meanings.sent1: He enjoyed smoking his churchwarden while reading a book.
meanings.sent2: The old man cherished his antique churchwarden.
meanings.sent3: The churchwarden accidentally rolled off the table, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: His churchwarden was like a loyal companion, always by his side.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of tobacco filled the room from the churchwarden.
